newsitem.title: USA: US West Coast prods flat to lower as buyers vanish.
newsitem.headline: US West Coast prods flat to lower as buyers vanish.

text.p: Wholesale prices for U.S. West Coast refined products were flat to weaker Friday in a quiet pre-weekend market that saw buyers vanish, traders said.
Energy futures on NYMEX fell sharply Friday, as high inventories and production nationwide left markets oversupplied.
"Nothing's getting done, because it's all sellers," one broker said of the inactive market. "Buyers don't want to buy because (NYMEX) is down everyday," he added.

July crude oil fell 87 cents a barrel to $18.79 cents, and refiner products plunged in sympathy. Unleaded gasoline for July was 2.69 cents a gallon lower at 57.13 cents while heating oil slid 1.80 cents a gallon at 51.52 cents.
Offers for Los Angeles regular CARB-grade cleaner burning gasoline dropped 0.50 cents to 59.50 cents a gallon Friday.
Prompt regular unleaded gasoline in Los Angeles was offered at 56.50 cents, 1.00 cents cents lower than Thursday, traders said.
L.A. CARB diesel fuel was flat from Thursday at 60/61 cents.
San Francisco products were flat to 1.00 cent a gallon lower than L.A.
